Sentence: The messenger speaks for King Philip of France, who supports Arthur's claim as the rightful heir to the throne; when John refuses to step down, France threatens war
Philip and John's armies go to war, but are so equally matched that neither side wins
Marry Philip's son Louis to John's niece Blanche, they suggest, then peace can be settled
Philip, whose family has just been linked to John's by marriage, hesitates while his (John) nobles try to influence him (John)
Finally Philip gives in and breaks with John
